title.narrative: SPECIALIZED PROGRAMMES (EDUCATION OOSC)

description.narrative: Specialized educational programmes for out of school boys and girls, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Education â€“ General, Evaluation, Evaluation (Covid), Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Health â€“ General, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Nutrition â€“ General, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice (Covid), Reducing Child Poverty, Research, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the most excluded boys and girls benefit from enhanced and inclusive public policies and services and actively participate in decision making processes.*Children most expected to benefit: Afro-descendant, Quilombolas, indigenous people, children with disabilities, with HIV/AIDS, in rural areas and in vulnerable urban territories, LGBT youth.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Specialized educational programmes for out of school boys and girls

description.narrative: In 2021 UNICEF increased its evidence-based advocacy efforts for the Safe School Reopening due to devastating impact on children and adolescents not receiving formal or non-formal education during the COVID-19. Through UNICEF supported programmes, 3,078 municipalities and 22 states were engaged and implementingSchool Active Search(SAS) strategy. In 2021, several events were held, such as lectures, technical meetings, webinars, aiming to mobilize and disseminate the SAS strategy to the new municipal administrations and make them aware of its re-engagement. With that,19,647out-of-school children and adolescents were re-enrolled in schools in 2021. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:15/01/2022
